author: Brian Reigh
title: Deal: buy two Google Homes and get $30 off
text:
If you were looking to buy multiple Google Home devices, this is your chance: Google is offering $30 off when you buy two Google Homes right now.
See also: Google Home review – the future of the home? November 18, 2016 Voice assistants at home are arguably the next big thing at the moment. What really started with Amazon’s Echo devices is expected to grow exponentially over the next decade or so. In fact, Alexa is expected to bring $11 billion in revenue for Amazon by 2020 , and s mart speaker shipments are predicted to be over 24 million this year , compared to a mere 6.5 million last year.
Google Home is Amazon Echo’s biggest rival right now, offering the best of Google’s services at a much lower price. Well, the search giant is sweetening the pot by giving you a $30 discount when you buy two Google Home devices. If you have a big house, this might be perfect for you since Google Home devices can sync with one another for things like playing music.
Head on over to Google’s official store , and once you select two Google Homes, you should see that the final price comes out to be $229, instead of $258. There is a limit to how many Google Homes you can buy though: the maximum is two orders, meaning the maximum number of Google Homes per consumer is limited to four. Unfortunately, single unit purchases will remain at a regular $129.

Google does not specify when the deal will end, but simply states that it’ll be available while supplies last. You can also get the same deal through Best Buy , Verizon , and B&H Photo Video .
Do you own a Google Home? Will you be taking advantage of this deal? Let us know by elaving a comment down below!
